website_summaries.verdict: These chips are made from 100% apple, not mixed with other types of wood.
pros: Wood chips work great for smoking
easy way to try different types of wood
Kiln-dried, good-quality chips don't need to be soaked before use
cons: Flavor not as potent as some others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! BUT....
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it is supposed to do, but I found the exact same item at Walmart for $1.88. My loss.
customer_reviews.author: quinnrichard

customer_reviews.title: Oak, a smooth smoky flavor.
customer_reviews.text: Our area does not have oak chips in the grocery store. Somewhere near Knoxville TN and North Carolina border there was a sign, THE WORLDS BEST RIBS. So I stopped there and they were super! ! ! I asked the cook, whose name was the same as the restaurant. "What do you smoke with"... the answer was" half hickory and half oak" ( I live in Memphis, maybe the best BBQ in the country ) Oak and Hickory together give a nice gently two note smoky flavor.
customer_reviews.author: bargbill

customer_reviews.title: Real Hickory Wood -  Not "Hickory flavored" hardwood.
customer_reviews.text: These smoking chips are excellent! This is one of four different kinds of wood I purchased from Western Premium BBQ Products. All of them have been amazing, although Hickory is still my favorite. This product is the real deal, and the flavor proves it! Beware of cheap brands!!! Cheaper brands use cheaper hardwoods and simply flavor the wood with Hickory (or other) oil. This never works right, because the true flavor comes from the thermal breakdown of the various lignins that make up each kind of wood. Simply adding an oil doesn't do the trick. I'm using all of these in my Smoke Hollow 26142E 26-Inch Electric Smoker, and the results are finger-lickin' good!
customer_reviews.author: Calipete

customer_reviews.title: Usually good, but large, inconsistent chip size this time
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these chips (a variety of woods) for a few years now as the chips are consistent in size and will feed well through my automatic (gravity) chip feeder. However, in this recent bag of oak chips, the top of the bag was filled with large 4-6 inch pieces of oak. The rest of the bag was OK. Looks like someone topped off the bag with these large "chips". I would have retured the bag, but it was too late as it had been a few months since I ordered it. I had to throw out those large chunks as there was no easy way to cut them smaller (I tried!).
customer_reviews.author: Another Prime addict

customer_reviews.title: A great flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift for my brother. He recently got himself a name brand ceramic cooker. I had done some research on the proper wood to use for these grills and all of the information I could find came back mixed. Some people highly recommend using chips over blocks and vice versa. I purchased these mainly because I hadn't heard of PEACH smoking chips before. He has not been disappointed! I've enjoyed the smoked meats too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Great chips saves you $
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality wood chips we soak then about 30.min. or so in cool water we think this helps to release the most flavor. Remember a little goes a long way. Super great smoke flavor to the food your smoking. No bitter taste. These wood chips are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma W

customer_reviews.title: Oak glorious oak!
customer_reviews.text: In the past 12 years we've used nearly all of the common smoking chips but hadn't tried oak. So glad we finally did! Got a bag of this for under $6. Smoked an eye of round to make deli-style roast beef. The oak was the most perfect smoke for it! Mild and flavorful, it complements the meat without becoming a flavor until itself. You know it's there, but it doesn't overwhelm. Turns out many of our favorite smokehouses (Southern Soul on St. Simon's Island, Georgia for example) use oak. Get a bag or two of this and you will NOT regret it!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Kamado Joe Classic II 18" grill
customer_reviews.text: I tried these smoking chips in my Kamado Joe Classic II 18" grill to smoke a turkey for Thanksgiving and it turned out to be a great success. I had to supplement the chips with the Kamado Joe Big Block lump charcoal because the chips did burn/smoke fairly quickly. This was a great trial run before buying larger smoking chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I am smoking our Thanksgiving turkey. I always use apple chips after an overnight brine of apple cider. How great it was to have the apple wood chips delivered right to my door with no need to go shopping around for the apple wood chips. I was delighted as always with Western's great product, fast delivery and no need to fight traffic and wonder if I would find apple wood chips. From previous experience I know the fine quality of this product and I know my turkey will have that great smoked apple flavor.
customer_reviews.author: The Pelican

customer_reviews.title: Best Wood Smoke Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: My Favourite Of The Smoking Woods Have The Standards ,Oak ,Hickory, Mesquite,Cherry ,Pecan Apple and ForJamaican Jerk ,Pimento, But MyAll Time Favourite it The Peach! I Make My Own Bacon With It ,cook Steaks and Chicken! Can’t Be Beat it’s Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Tobias

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: As expected.. Maple chips play a big part in the mix I use for smoking. I hate I have to buy it packaged like this because of cost, but if you live south of I-80 Maple in quantity is hard to find. It seems to smoke well and I have not noticed any other species mixed in with it. Better bang for the buck would yield 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Good quality chips
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality chips. Product arrives in sealed bag, the chips are dry, and ready to smoke. The flavor is real and intense. These chips are medium sized but randomly distributed in quantity and size and shape. No super large chunks, a few super small chunks though. Overall, however, when proper temperature controlled the super small pieces won't catch fire and will smoke intensely. Very reasonably priced. Very good. Worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie in NWTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Mild smoky flavor
customer_reviews.text: These apple smoking chips pair really well with chicken breasts that I smoked in my electric smoker. They were the most tender chicken breasts I’ve ever had. These chips don’t have an over powering smoky flavor compared to mesquite or hickory. Definitely recommend these chips for poultry. I also only paid a few dollars for these chips which are a great deal here on Amazon compared to 6.99 at my local Safeway store.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor for chicken
customer_reviews.text: We purchased one of those smokers which look like a crockpot, we just did not have room (or money) for the larger smokers. We have been very happy with the smoker and have experimented with several types of wood. These apple chips give a super flavor to chicken (not so good for beef) and we are very happy with it. Our only negative remark is about the size of some of the chips, they are too big for us to use. However, the chips are not specifically for the smaller chip area in the type of smoker we have, so I really can't ding them much for that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Everton

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Burnt well in my smoker box and created a nice smoke on my barbecue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The right choice of wood chips for your electric smoker!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an electric smoker last year and have been very happy with the Western Premium wood smoking chips. I love the flavor of the hickory for smoking sausage, hams and pork shoulders. The flavor is amazing. I soak the chips for a half hour then add them to my smoker. They last quite long and I only add more when I'm smoking for more than 4 hours or so. Their Mesquite flavor is perfect for my beef brisket, ribs and roasts. Sometimes I mix the flavors and have never been disappointed. One bag of chips will give me several uses. Just me sure to keep your water tray filled and don't get the smoker to hot.
customer_reviews.author: RayRay

customer_reviews.title: This rating has to do with the price, not ...
customer_reviews.text: This rating has to do with the price, not the quality (the wood chips are fantastic). You can find these same wood chips (same size) at Walmart for less than $3.00 per bag. They also have Pecan, Apple, Hickory, Mesquite and Cherry wood chips.
customer_reviews.author: amh

customer_reviews.title: Not so chippy...
customer_reviews.text: Been a year since I had to reorder. I use a MES 40 and the wood chips on this latest package were more like wood strands. Long and in unaccommodating in my smoker. I noticed the packaging was different also. The smoke and flavor was about the same so I'm just wondering if this isn't a cheaper way to produce them.
customer_reviews.author: Sev

customer_reviews.title: best freaking ribeye steaks you will ever devour in your ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for some time now, no soak, right on the coals, Indirect, smoked for about 30 minutes....best freaking ribeye steaks you will ever devour in your entire life. Impress your friends, make your partner swoon.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Smells amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift for my brother. He recently got himself a name brand ceramic cooker. I had done some research on the proper wood to use for these grills and all of the information I could find came back mixed. Some people highly recommend using chips over blocks and vice versa. I purchased these because of what other reviewers had to say. He has not been disappointed! I've enjoyed the smoked meats too.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price you paid.  Never again.
customer_reviews.text: So my stars are for the pricing, not the product. The Never again refers to the price. You are paying PRIME rate for shipping this product all right. It is only $1.99 at Academy Sports. Do your own research. I will buy it, but never here.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Peach flavor is sweet and subtle
customer_reviews.text: Peach wood is very sweet and has amazing results in my smoker. Western woods are the way to go no matter what kind of wood. Their chips are perfect in apple, peach, cherry or pecan. I have at least one bag of each kind on hand at all times and when any are running low I order another
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Applewood chips are phenomenal and a value.
customer_reviews.text: The Applewood chips were a steal at under $3 per 180 cubic inch package. A nice sweet and mild smoke, great on pork, tritip, chicken, and my favorite smoked trout or salmon. Absolutely tasty flavor, burns really nicely in a gas grill smoker box sitting on the burner on low. Dry chip make smoke in about a minute that way for a quick smoke on burgers or a low heat long smoke for something like fish. Can’t beat the value and the flavor is phenomenal. Will buy again as long as it’s available.
customer_reviews.author: Levi B.

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor and value
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these on a whim and are happy with the quality, value and scent. I use them in a grill box and they do take awhile to start smoking but when they do they smell great add the flavor. I was happy to see they were well priced compared to in store.
customer_reviews.author: Review King

customer_reviews.title: Make a packet of chips with aluminum foil and throw them on your coals!
customer_reviews.text: Make a little pouch/packet with aluminum foil and fill it to the top with chips, and put some hole into the packet, and the chips will start to char inside the foil and put out smoke, and fill your grill with smoke it will taste amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor, even burn
customer_reviews.text: Used it to smoke 40 lbs of pork shoulder for the 4th of July. Finished product's flavor was excellent and chips burned evenly in my electric smoker's hopper. I'll never go back to hickory for pulled pork - pecan is the way to go and you can't go wrong with this particular bag of chips!
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Aroma, Fair Price, Even Burn
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to smoke a beef brisket in my electric smoker. The chips burned even an smoked very well. Great aroma and hickory smoke taste. The chips were slightly larger than chips I've used in the past, but it didn't seem to make much of a difference at the end of the day. The flavor of the chips was slightly stronger than other brand chips I've used in recent past. I would purchase these chips again.
customer_reviews.author: pculter

customer_reviews.title: My Goto for Brisket
customer_reviews.text: It's the perfect wood to compliment brisket. I use primarily post oak and just a hint of mesquite (10%) with, typically, a 16 -18 hour smoke at 250°. Looking for an internal temperature of 203°. Be forewarned, women will swoon and men get all misty eyed and emotional. Ask for sauce and we'll politely ask you to leave. It's that good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Welch

customer_reviews.title: Very good chips, were cheap...what happened?
customer_reviews.text: I got these things for less than $3 a bag and I went back to get more just a few days later and I can't find them anywhere under $9/bag some sellers as high as $14 - what gives? They are not worth more than $3 as they burn way to fast but sometimes that isn't bad...I did soak mine down with apple juice in a mixing bowl as I feed the smoker but really...why the jacked up prices all of a sudden?
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Great wood chips but suggest also getting wood Chunks
customer_reviews.text: Hickory is one of my favorite woods to smoke with. Keep in mind that wood CHIPS are consumed (burn up) much quicker then wood CHUNKS, so require more frequent reloads. These work very well for my Propane Smoker and begin to smoke almost immediately, which is great. I usually mix the chips with chunks to get the quick initial smoke from the chips and also longer lasting smoke from the chunks
customer_reviews.author: Larry K

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: The product title states "6.48 lb", the actual amount is 180 cubic inches, about 1.2 pounds
customer_reviews.author: A. Mikhailovsky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the first time ever. I used it in Oster Smoker Roaster Oven. I smoked a whole chicken, and didn’t need to refill the wood chips pockets in the smoker. It burned nicely, gave wonderful flavor to my meat! Definitely a great addition to smoking! I’m sure it’ll be great for grilling as well.
customer_reviews.author: sladjy

customer_reviews.title: All My Smoked Meat Approves
customer_reviews.text: Cherry was the first wood I really used to smoke, and I keep coming back to it. I always buy wood on sale, no matter how much I have currently. I used this on a number of different meats, and the friends/family agreed it was a good taste to everything. I will be buying again when the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Colonel Angus

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you BBQ Texas style
customer_reviews.text: Living on the east coast I find it's a little harder to find oak chips for BBQ smoking so this has become my go to for supply. Of the three times I've ordered only once have the chips appeared to have been of reduced quality (slightly more dried out then normal, not as "fresh" looking). They have all shipped on time and still impart a great flavor on my BBQ. Highly recommend these chips.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Good for chips. On the smaller side.
customer_reviews.text: The are a good value bag for the price but are small to very small in size. I would recommend supplementing with larger chunks. Average size is slightly larger then a thumb nail. Be sure to fully soak and expect to add to your pan often. Chips are cleaner then some other brands that I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: G. VO

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor!
customer_reviews.text: Love pecan chips, heck I love pecan nuts so I don't know why I never tried the wood before. Pecan adds a great flavor, not as strong as Hickory and not as mild as apple or cherry. It's a nice middle of the road smoke. Western has nice size chips too, not so small that they burn up immediately.
customer_reviews.author: SHERI N

customer_reviews.title: Keep your eye on the price
customer_reviews.text: These drop price for certain flavors sometimes, and then they do, jump on it. These are truly great wood chips. You can find this brand at the local store and keep an eye for when the price drops and pick them up here. I have repurchased several times.
customer_reviews.author: KarlitosWay

customer_reviews.title: Peach is a bit weak for electric smoker
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of Western and use their chips exclusively when smoking in my electric smoker. I was excited to see this flavor, but the wood just wasn't bold enough to get into the meat. My favorite are their apple chips, mesquite, hickory and pecan...but I wasn't impressed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Good quality smoking chips.
customer_reviews.text: This product was an Add-On item for only $2.99. This size bag of hickory chips typically sells for at least $5.99. I have used these chips before and they impart a very nice flavor to beef or pork. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lee3m

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used so far
customer_reviews.text: This bag is incredibly cheap, yet it is also the best wood chips I've used, and by quite a large margin. They burn perfectly. A ton of smoke, it doesn't take time to get smoke, they last for a surprising amount of time, and they add an amazing flavor. It makes me so happy that the best wood chips I've used are also the cheapest I've used. This is some really good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Do not soak too much at a time, unless ready to use it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased three different flavors, but have used only the hickory one so far. Was so impressed with the amount of flavors with only a handful of chips, that not only plan on purchasing again, but look forward to see what the other flavors might bring!
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Adds amazing smoke flavor to our meats!
customer_reviews.text: We are currently using these in our Masterbuilt 20071117 30" Digital Electric Smoker that we got at the same time here on Amazon and are super happy with the flavor these add to our meats. The electric smoker makes it easy to add these as it is cooking and we are not seeing any wasted or burnt chips. Will order these again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: M Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff for a Great a Price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift to a family friend and he cooks a lot of BBQ. So far it seems it was great! They said the used just a little bit of these wood chips and it made the BBQ taste amazing! It’s a good deal considering the amount for this price so I highly suggest this if you want to spruce up your BBQ game!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Wang

customer_reviews.title: Wood chips contain dirt.
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of wood chips in smoking meats. This is the first time I've gotten a bag of wood chips and soaked them only to find sludge in the jar after removing the wood chips. Turns out these hips are contaminated by dirt and sand. No way of identifying what's in sludge, but better judgement tells me not to use these when smoking a food item as I have no idea if it has other contaminants. Threw them out.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Super with brisket!
customer_reviews.text: Chips are fairly uniform in size and work well in our Master Built electronic smoker's chip tray. I believe these are post oak as they have a somewhat different color, texture, and aroma when burning than the white oak wine and whiskey barrel chips and red oak chips that we also use. They give a sweet smoky flavor that is terrific on brisket done in the Central Texas style.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Hesley

customer_reviews.title: Better luck next time.....
customer_reviews.text: The flavor just was not with these chips. I soaked them in water like I always do, smoked my ham in the smoker along with these chips and I was sorely disappointed. I was really hoping off all the reviews that they were better than other brands I have purchased. Don't get me wrong, I have had a lot worse, but I have had a lot better. I think I should have stuck with my cherry chips. Pro - good price Cons - little flavor, burned super fast so little smoke
customer_reviews.author: Keene Family

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: Got a great simple recipe for Texas pulled pork on the internet. It was from How to BBQ Right on YouTube, and it required post oak. Didn't find any locally, so ordered this product. The best pulled pork ive had, and so simple. Try it for sure, it won't disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great chips for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are great chips for the money. I bought these under $3 a bag. So for the price and the flavor you get with these I can't complain. I might buy more soon for that price. I also use an electric smoker and I don't soak them.
customer_reviews.author: timcxt

customer_reviews.title: Small bag but small chips are all needed for great flavor
customer_reviews.text: So, it's not to increase heat, but to make smoke with water soaking the wood chips on a metal grate inside the grill. It will create wood flavor. Nowadays people use liquid smoke to apply flavor. Old style and good source of dry wood chips.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Knight

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: The price was really good (under $2), so I figured there wouldn't be much in a package. The package had at least twice as many wood chips as I expected. They were a gift for someone else, who assumed that I paid 3x as much per bag. As I didn't use thems I can't speak to the flavor or quality of the chips.
customer_reviews.author: Steph. Trinen

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL ESSENCE AND FLAVOR
customer_reviews.text: These are the best apple chips I've found, and have re-ordered them. The essence and flavor are perfect, without overwhelming. Also, the size of the chips are perfect for my MasterBuilt Smoker's chip tray. I highly recommend these chips.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great little smoker
customer_reviews.text: It's the second one of this model that I've owned, the first lasted for 15 years. Simple to use and produces delicious grub! There are more sophisticated models available, with bluetooth, remote temp reading, glass door (turns black pretty fast) and other unnecessary features. This unit will cook whole chickens, wings, ribs, pork shoulder, you name it. Smoked a prime rib roast and it came out perfect. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Call me Snake

customer_reviews.title: They All Taste The Same To Me
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can't tell the difference in the flavor of one smoking chip from another.
customer_reviews.author: Ken A.

customer_reviews.title: Great maple smoke taste and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Great for using in the presto indoor smoker/slow cooker when you are smoking Scotch eggs, bacon, pork, ham, poultry, breakfast sausage, ribs, baked beans, breakfast pizza....ect. Also, great for electric and gas smokers too!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Add a little cherry!
customer_reviews.text: We are big "smokers" whether it's in a box on the grill, our little electric smoker, or our old converted upright freezer (yes, it works awesome too). We love to mix chips too. There's lots of room to play with flavors. Have fun & experiment! Price here on Amazon is cheaper (plus more selection) than our local store. Admittedly I live in a rural area.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Onnen

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I was made to wait for this product. When the product did arrive, package was opened and came with tape wrapped around the top to keep it closed. Impossible to know entire amount I paid for was there.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my needs and I love the value for money spent. I grill very frequently and enjoy experimenting with different wood chips. These were very cheap and easy to use in both my charcoal grill and gas grill.
customer_reviews.author: pdilly

customer_reviews.title: Delicious flavored meat coming your way!
customer_reviews.text: Used this in a vertical electric smoker to make some pulled pork. It was the best pulled pork I had ever had. The wood chips would burn about 1 cup an hour and a half at 225
customer_reviews.author: Dallin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take long when soaked in water for them to be added to the charcoal. I smoked 5 Tri-tips using half a bag of chips soaked in water, a little at a time. The smoky flavor was close to being overwelming.
customer_reviews.author: comanche

customer_reviews.title: Great bark on my brisket!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because I could not find oak chips at big box stores. Great price. Smoked a brisket in an electric smoker for over 16 hours, and gave the brisket a great taste, and bark. Not overpowering. Simple. Everyone loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Makes chicken taste amazing
customer_reviews.text: Product and packaging were fine. I just wanted to add this review to say that cherry wood does amazing things to chicken. Better than apple wood to my palate.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Western Premium BBQ Smoking Chips, Apple BBQ
customer_reviews.text: Great Flavor and are better than Traeger Chips. The only thing that I noticed is that the pellets are harder than the Traeger and more expensive but the flavor they add to the meats are Great.
customer_reviews.author: Hammercl

customer_reviews.title: Good strong flavor
customer_reviews.text: Don't overload the box with chips. It only takes a few chips to smoke for an hour or so. I also soak mine in water for an hour before cooking. Makes a better smoke plume.
customer_reviews.author: BriansMac

customer_reviews.title: Bought for cocktail infusions.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality chips. No splintering or dust. Tossed on a tray and toasted black in the oven in no time. Used the toasted chips to oak age a bourbon cocktail in about 3-4 weeks. Mellows out hot cocktails greatly.
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great chips saves you $
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality wood chips we soak then about 30.min. or so in cool water we think this helps to release the most flavor. Remember a little goes a long way. Super great smoke flavor to the food your smoking. No bitter taste. These wood chips are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Wilma W

customer_reviews.title: Going to try chunks next time
customer_reviews.text: Was alright for doing ribs. Had wanted to try it for a bit now and can't find peach in any store around where I live. Going to try the chunks next time as these burn up way too fast in a grill. Had a second grill going with apple wood chunks to see what everyone thought came out better and some liked the apple better and most couldn't tell the difference between the two. These mite burn better in a electric or gas smoker.
customer_reviews.author: David Roy

customer_reviews.title: Texas style bbq
customer_reviews.text: It's very cost effective. I saw that BBQ with Franklin only used post oak wood and I had to follow the man! I've made brisket and wings. So delicious! I love smoked food 😍😍

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for grilling season!
customer_reviews.text: These are my hubby's favorite brand of wood chips, and Amazon has a great price. I thought my husband was just over-enthused about his grilling "toys" and tactics, but I have to admit that the wood chips make a huge difference in the taste! So great. Buy with this as a companion, and you're set!
customer_reviews.author: E. B. North

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor
customer_reviews.text: Ooooh the things you can smoke (in a smoker of course). Family really liked the flavor of this brand. I rocked the mac and cheese with this. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Pama

customer_reviews.title: My burgers had a terrible taste
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm using these wrong, but my burgers tasted terrible. Definitely had a smokey flavor but it was not good. Could feel it in my stomach for a few hours after eating.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S

customer_reviews.title: I started using a tray to hold it but felt like it wasn't doing a good enough job
customer_reviews.text: Ever since buying this I've been experimenting with my Weber grill. I started using a tray to hold it but felt like it wasn't doing a good enough job. I instead just throw the soaked chips onto the coals. I love the smokey flavor and have been grilling almost every other night now. Will be buying more for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Nk

customer_reviews.title: Crazy Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: These work great and the price from Amazon cant be touched by local stores. One of the best deals I have found for smoking butts, turkeys and brisket.
customer_reviews.author: A K Q 10 2

customer_reviews.title: Smelled Like Apples
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, while smoking the chips you could definitely smell the apple but didn't really have it in the meat, so that was disappointing. We're going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Weston & Lacey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Apple Scent Wood
customer_reviews.text: The apple scent of this wood makes you feel that you are in an apple farm. It has a very relaxing scent and when used to smaoke meat the apple digs deep into the flesh. It really lets you taste the apple flavor.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLa

customer_reviews.title: Good quality wood to bring the smoke
customer_reviews.text: Good consistent chips that bring a good flavor to smoked meats. I have bought this brand numerous times and I have always been pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: redlegger

customer_reviews.title: Peach perfection
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a trial and was not disappointed with choosing peach! I would like to be able to buy this is quantity and in chunks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, no smell
customer_reviews.text: These chips had no smell and offered no flavor to the meat I was cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Irena

customer_reviews.title: Yummy!
customer_reviews.text: Cherry Chips. My absolute favorite. Obviously, well favored by many. Cherry Chips, most difficult to find. Price on point!
customer_reviews.author: Tpaskygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great hickory smoke
customer_reviews.text: Bag is filled with the right size chips for smoking. From what I can tell, it is filled with just hickory and there are no stray vegetation thrown in. I've smoked a turkey and sausages with these chips and the meat came out with great flavor.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kooiman

customer_reviews.title: Great wood.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could get more. We used up the wood already. Dont understand why the prices on Hickory Chips moves around like fuel prices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: oak is the best
customer_reviews.text: I used this oak wood for thighs and drums tonight. I'll use other woods to supplement the oak, but oak is my go to. Sweet and never harsh in my experience. Western is a good brand for chunks or chips, clean product and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: California shopper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hickory wood
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand of these chips. They work good are well broken into small pieces. They burn good and offer up a lot of smoke. I also bought some peach wood chips that looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: and brisket with them and it all tasted great!
customer_reviews.text: I mean to order wood chunks but got the chips by accident instead, so that was disappointing cause I had to go throw more on the smoker much more often than I'm used to. That said, I made pulled pork, pulled lamb, smoked salmon, and brisket with them and it all tasted great!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Goldenberg

customer_reviews.title: Add flavor capability to your gas grill!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This adds awesome flavor to the grilled items. I do recommend moistening the chips prior to the use (unlike the description on the packet). Dry chips caught flame in a few mins and got charred quickly.
customer_reviews.author: OnlyShopOnline

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need for getting the great BBQ flavor
customer_reviews.text: It's actually a Weber product, nice bag of chips and chunks. Only problem... I've almost used up the bag on 2 smoking runs! If they made a larger bag I'd be set!
customer_reviews.author: schnauzer

customer_reviews.title: Great chips
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for my digital smoker. I used them to smoke two hole chickens and a turkey for Thanksgiving, and they turned out very tasty... Always choose a fruit tree wood for smoking poultry. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for chicken or ribs. Gives a flavor that can’t be found with any other wood. Can’t find this in stores in the southwest so I was excited to find them on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer & Josh

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and can be used for any type of meat.
customer_reviews.text: Adds great flavor to any grilled meats. Chips are able to be utilized multiple ways. Good value for quantity provided. Should last me the whole season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BBQ chips
customer_reviews.text: Pretty big bag. Good price. Peach is subtle but nice. Doesn’t knock you over like mesquite. My favorite is apple wood.
customer_reviews.author: fourbyfive

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is huge on smoking meat (brisket and ribs are favorites). He loves these chips! The oak is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: GLeigh

customer_reviews.title: Bags are "half full", and have not measured the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bags are "half full", and have not measured the volume to see if it matches what it is being sold as. Until I find a source of apple wood on my own, this will have to do. Chips are small, and would prefer them to be in between the size of chips-chunks, but is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Potter

customer_reviews.title: CHERRY WOOD CHIPS
customer_reviews.text: The bags are bigger than we thought, so we will have Cherry wood for awhile... we smoke our ham with cherry wood and it makes them yummy
customer_reviews.author: LK Wade

customer_reviews.title: Adds great flavor to grilled food
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves to grill out. These woodchips add great flavor. We buy these all the time and will continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracyb75

customer_reviews.title: It's wood. lol. but, for their price ...
customer_reviews.text: It's wood. lol. but, for their price you might as well get a whole tree.
customer_reviews.author: B. Feist

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: This was a lot of bang for your buck!!!! Like cheaper than anywhere around here and could smell it opening the Amazon box!!! Great for smoking 👌
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth lay

customer_reviews.title: Love these. Perfect for chicken or pork
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Perfect for chicken or pork. These chips have given anything I've smoked in my electric smokera wonderful light, fruity flavor.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: My meat tastes smoky
customer_reviews.text: Adds a delicious smoky flavor to my meat. My meat tastes great with this wood. Grilling will never be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Steadmoore Kellerson III

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Smooth smoky flavor.
customer_reviews.text: These hickory chips are at such a good price. I smoke at least 2x a month. These chips have a sweet smoky flavor.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: A subtle flavor
customer_reviews.text: If you’re used to mesquite, apple, cherry and such this will be very subtle for you. Its not a bad smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Void

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TASTE
customer_reviews.text: These made the brisket we made using these chips taste amazing. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: caliladylawyer

product_meta.title: Western Premium BBQ Smoking Chips, Apple BBQ
product_meta.description: Flavor:AppleEnjoy the distinct apple smoke flavor from Western Premium BBQ Products. Take your cookout to the next level with Western Premium BBQ Products Apple BBQ Smoking Chips. They are made from real heat-treated apple wood to deliver a robust flavor to every meal. Apple smoke can give your smoked meats a bold new layer of flavor. Smoking chips are a great way to add depth to the taste of your next barbequed meal. Kudos to you, fellow grill master. You got this far by adding some wood smoking chips to your grill to infuse your meats with an apple flavor. Western Premium BBQ Products Apple BBQ Smoking Chips are easy to use and they work on gas grills, charcoal grills, and electric smokers. The next time you’re thinking of making smoked meat for the family, add some Western Premium BBQ Products Apple BBQ Smoking Chips to the grilling process. Be the cookout hero your friends and family deserve! If you’re using wood chips for smoking your meats on a gas or charcoal grill, place dry wood chips in a foil pack or a smoke box and place them over the heat. Let the apple chips start smoking, and then move them to one side of your grill. Place your meat on the grill and close the lid. Cook to time or temperature you normally would, keeping the lid closed as much as possible. If you’re using wood smoking chips in a charcoal grill, load your grill with lump charcoal. Light the charcoal using your preferred method; however, we would recommend you avoid using lighter fluid, so your meat retains the natural apple smoke flavor. Several minutes prior to cooking, fill a smoker tray or a foil pouch with one to two handfuls of chips. Place the tray or pouch on the hottest part of the grill surface until it begins to smoke. Once the chips have begun smoking, move them with tongs to make room for your future meal. Add your meat to the grill, close the lid, and smoke until you achieve that great apple smoke flavor.
feature_bullets: Apple wood heat treated to eliminate and prevent pests, mold, or rot. 100% Natural.
180 cubic Inches of large sized Apple BBQ Smoking Chips per package.
Try Western Premium BBQ Products Apple BBQ Smoking Chips with these American favorites: Hamburgers, Whole Chicken, BBQ Smoked Wings, or Baby Back or Spare Ribs.
Apple BBQ Smoking Chips for a charcoal, gas, or electric grill. See description for cooking instructions.
Use to make a variety of apple smoked meat. Delicious with Beef Sirloin or Filets, Salmon or Trout, Braised Brisket, or Pork Loin.
